_comment: Created by ianb on 14/10/2013 11:39:46 using v0.9
title: How has the number of staff working extra hours changed by provider?
analysis_commentary: The increase in the number of staff reporting working extra hours (both unpaid and paid) between 2011 and 2012 was seen in 218 trusts (89% of all trusts that exist in both the 2011 and 2012 data). This may be a reflection of the anecdotal evidence that staff numbers have been reduced as the NHS tries to achieve the 'Nicholson challenge' of saving £20 billion by 2015. The change in the set of organisations where there is an increased reporting of working extra hours ranges between >0% and 13.78%.
data_source: Department of Health, Survey of NHS staff
